security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic sources. Minimal audit performed and no issues noted. Content is documentation-focused with examples only.

content.value_statement: Plugins often fail to load because the structure is wrong. This skill explains the required layout, manifest rules, and component paths.
actual_capabilities: Explain required plugin root layout and component folders
Describe plugin.json fields and valid path rules
Clarify auto-discovery for commands, agents, skills, and hooks
Guide use of ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for portable paths
Provide minimal, standard, and advanced plugin examples
limitations: Does not generate files or scaffold a plugin
Does not validate plugin.json with a tool
Does not run tests or execute scripts
Examples are illustrative and not executable

use_cases.description: Get a clear directory structure and manifest checklist before creating files.

use_cases.title: Standardize plugin conventions
use_cases.description: Define naming rules and component placement for team consistency.

use_cases.title: Design complex plugin layouts
use_cases.description: Choose patterns for large plugins with MCP servers and hooks.

prompt_templates.title: Start a plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the minimum folder structure and required plugin.json fields for a simple Claude Code plugin with one command.

prompt_templates.title: Add components
prompt_templates.prompt: Show where to place agents and skills and how auto-discovery works. Include naming conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Custom paths
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to use commands and agents paths in plugin.json with rules for ./ prefixes and no parent paths.

prompt_templates.title: Enterprise layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a scalable plugin structure with hooks, MCP servers, shared libraries, and clear directory grouping.

output_examples.input: I need the correct structure for a plugin with commands and hooks.
output: Place plugin.json in .claude-plugin at the root

best_practices: Use kebab-case for folders and files
Keep plugin.json minimal and add metadata for publishing
Prefer default directories before adding custom paths
anti_patterns: Skipping SKILL.md in a skill directory

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is specific to Claude Code plugin discovery and layout rules.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides documentation and examples but does not create or validate files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with MCP servers?
faq.answer: It explains how to declare MCP servers in .mcp.json or plugin.json.

faq.question: Does it access my data or repositories?
faq.answer: No. It is documentation only and does not access files or send data.

faq.question: What if my plugin components do not load?
faq.answer: Check folder placement, file extensions, YAML frontmatter, and the plugin.json path rules.

faq.question: How does it compare to a scaffold tool?
faq.answer: It teaches structure and rules but does not generate a scaffold.
